website_summaries.verdict: For ramps that are both cheaper and wider than the competition, these Highland ramps are a great choice.
pros: These extra-lightweight ramps hold a surprising amount of weight at a combined max capacity of 1,250 pounds
For the price, these are a great deal
cons: These ramps do not fold and have zero arch

customer_reviews.title: Won't work for lawn mowers.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for what I needed them for which is driving a lawnmower into the back of my truck. I suppose its my fault for not doing the math and figuring out how far apart the rungs were before I ordered this, but either way it won't work for lawn mowers, the wheels just get stuck in the gaps.
customer_reviews.author: James Clement

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: There is no way these ramps can hold as much weight as they claim. The top is not bent enough, so when we tried to get the motorcycle out of the truck they kept slipping and getting caught, even though they were securely tied. They could possibly work for a smaller motorcycle as long as it sits high enough off the ground. Do yourself a favor, spend a little more money and get a higher quality ramp. This is not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Doont buy to looad mower
customer_reviews.text: I bought to lad a 36" mower. If your buying for that dont. There are too big a gaps between each hole and dont work very well. Not sure about atv
customer_reviews.author: Erik V

customer_reviews.title: Beware-arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product arrived to our house damaged. The portions that lay on the edge of the truck bed were all bent. The outer box that the product arrived in was not bent or damaged at all. We do not want to have to deal with shipping them back, so my husband used a rubber mallet to straighten them out as best as he could. The picture shows the product after my husband did this.
customer_reviews.author: J. McKown

customer_reviews.title: nice ramps
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set to use with a small 5 x 8 flat trailer. I can use one or both depending on what I'm hauling and these ramps so far have been used to load a 500+ lbs. motorcycle and a large ATV. These came with an adjustable cam buckle lashing strap with a hook to secure the ramp to the trailer to keep it from moving when loading. These ramps are very light and easy to store (Mine are hanging sideways on two screw hooks attached to a garage roof joist). A great buy, I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: gs750e

customer_reviews.title: but don't seem as well built as I would like. There again
customer_reviews.text: If I had it to do again, I would have purchased the tri-fold type ramps. These are certainly hard to beat for the price, but don't seem as well built as I would like. There again, for the price I don't know that you'll find a less expensive option. However, for the loading / unloading of a Raptor 700 I would find something more substantial. They are definitely light enough to pick up and move around, but are a fixed length so they do have some storage restriction.
customer_reviews.author: Dustan D.

customer_reviews.title: These ramps are a great price compared to others and are very light weight
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are a great price compared to others and are very light weight. I have used them quite a bit now and had no issue with durability. I have 700lb atv that put a lot of weight on these also.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I have never used ramps before so I was unaware of this but the rung type work a lot better for larger wheels
customer_reviews.text: They look and feel weak but hold a lot. I have never used ramps before so I was unaware of this but the rung type work a lot better for larger wheels. Yes I am smart enough to assume that but I was expecting the rungs to be closer together. I use it to move my snow blower up a small flight of stairs and it works by hand but is quite difficult. Starting the blower up and driving it up is a lot easier. Next time I will get something different but these work good enough. Likely though I will never need another set of them because these will probably last longer than me,
customer_reviews.author: RustyJD

customer_reviews.title: they are probably not the best, but they do the trick
customer_reviews.text: If you looking at this item, its because of the cost. Its about half the cost of other aluminium ramps. they are probably not the best, but they do the trick, I have only used it once to get my new Snow Blower off my truck and they worked perfectly. So for snow blower and other smaller equipment I would totally recommend these ramps. If your using them for ATV and other larger equipment, I'm not sure how they would work, you may need something a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: PAHENRY

customer_reviews.title: too short for normal pickup trucks
customer_reviews.text: These are decent quality. The one tab that sets on the tailgate was bent up in the packaging. If you drive a lowered s10 these are for you. If you drive a normal pickup do not get these, or get em and send em back because theyre too short. Just get a set of foldin ramps
customer_reviews.author: Joslynn

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps. Needs decking to be useful for small wheel yard equipment
customer_reviews.text: I own a Pontiac Vibe and these were nearly perfect for getting a plug aerator into the back of my car. I only needed to add some 1/4" MDF board to the ramp with some self tapping screws. The straps hook up very nicely to the latch ring the back seats lock into. It keeps the ramps fairly secure. This was exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mac11b20

customer_reviews.title: Cheap aluminum, will bend and eventually break. Short term use 6 mo.
customer_reviews.text: Used these for loading up a Honda foreman on the back of my truck. After 6 months the aluminum started to bend. Now the ramp is so bowed that its unsafe to load with these . You get what you pay for. Cheap aluminum will eventually bend and break. These were a good short term solution instead of buying a trailer.
customer_reviews.author: miguel valdes

customer_reviews.title: Not next time
customer_reviews.text: Do the job for now. When I have a little extra money to spend, I will definitely be buying a new set from another provider and I am not going cheap. Just spend the 100 to 150 on a good set and don't waste your money. Have used handful of times for my Rancher 420. The angle could be a little better and thicker metal. Also the spacers on ramps are too big, can't use this for smaller tires. Light weight and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: I would reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Really good! I have a 6” lift on my truck and it’s already a hassle driving up my ATV and dirt bike up but the ramps do work and help so I would recommend them. But if you have a higher lift on your truck I would probably look for longer ramps
customer_reviews.author: SlumDiggity

customer_reviews.title: These did not hold up at all. It was ...
customer_reviews.text: These did not hold up at all. It was my sons birthday present for his 4 wheeler and they collapsed luckily not causing injury. The weight limit said 1250lbs at most he is at 1000 with him on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ahcoop44

customer_reviews.title: Not for anything with weight
customer_reviews.text: Used these to load a golf cart on to a trailer. I thought they were about to break in half. They would work great for light things.
customer_reviews.author: Boone

customer_reviews.title: Ramp
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for putting push behind lawnmower on truck not what the description says
customer_reviews.author: jerry henson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: First off, I didn't buy these for an ATV. I was looking for a way to get my dogs back in the boat so we didn't have to lift the soaking wet mongrels. Beats the $200-$300 that some people want who have built devices specifically for the task. Only needed one in fact (anyone with a dog and a boat out there?). They seem to be good quality as far as how they are made. Wasn't too concerned about the weight capacity but I wouldn't worry about it with these I think. They were the best price around from my homework.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift, which allowed the receiver to access the lawn mower with ease.
customer_reviews.author: gardener

customer_reviews.title: Over all good for our occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Affordable, and strong. Alittle short in length though. Makes for a steep incline (pick up truck). Over all good for our occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: nicole holstclaw

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and very sturdy, even better than I expected. Happy with my purchase other than the delivery screw up which turned out to be the USPS mess .
customer_reviews.author: lind

customer_reviews.title: Not long enough!
customer_reviews.text: Over all construction is decent. Very sharp edges so watch out not to get cut. Also not long enough to load my 4 wheeler. I have a ram 1500 so not a crazy high truck. Angle is too much for the quad to handle. Spins all 4 trying to climb it. If your planning on loading 4 wheelers into a pickup, don’t buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Valenti

customer_reviews.title: Very nice value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very nice value for the money, least expensive set of ramps i found on here(all the way to page 25!) and I am very satisfied. I am going to rivet some diamond plate to it, there is a pretty good gap between the rungs. big 4 wheeler would have no problem. thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Minuteman Signs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to load my john deere l120 on my trailer
customer_reviews.author: Frank B

customer_reviews.title: works great  for what i need
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to load driving carriages into the horse trailer. It works great for that. The rails are spaced too far apart for my utility wagon, which isn't a big deal. But if your wanting it for smaller wheels like that, you need to put plywood boards on top of it. It handled the 350lbs driving carriage just perfect!! It is 2 ramps and there are hooks to hook it to the bumper or tailgate etc. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mule girl

customer_reviews.title: good ramps
customer_reviews.text: ramps work great. love the straps on them that go to bumper of the truck. it keeps the ramps from moving when loading or unloading. they are a little short though. feels really steep when loading or unloading. they fit easily in a short bed truck
customer_reviews.author: Travis K.

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately their was not an accident
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in May 17', to load my child's 400lb ATV in the back of my truck. On the third use, one of the ramps bowed badly. Fortunately their was not an accident. I recommend purchasing stronger ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great price!  Works for what I need them for.
customer_reviews.text: for the price. These are awesome! I only use them for dirt bikes. a 250, 230 and a 125. But work great for them.
customer_reviews.author: Doghouse7

customer_reviews.title: these are good ramps I use them to load my grandsons atv
customer_reviews.text: these are good ramps I use them to load my grandsons atv,,just use the safety straps and you should have no problem's...oh and the price cant be beat....thanks
customer_reviews.author: 03bandit

customer_reviews.title: These came damaged on the ends so we had to ...
customer_reviews.text: These came damaged on the ends so we had to try to flatten them out in order to get our 4 wheeler loaded. Also, the straps both came on one of the ramps. That makes no sense when you want to secure each one individually.
customer_reviews.author: Reno Brinkley

customer_reviews.title: They are light weight and the safety straps work great.
customer_reviews.text: Not very strong. I used them to load a 200lb motorcycle and they really bent but didn't break. They are light weight and the safety straps work great.
customer_reviews.author: Actreader

customer_reviews.title: Not all things with wheels are easy to load
customer_reviews.text: I have a wood chipper and I can not load it. These ramps are good only for things with engines that are self propelled.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Kuwaye

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I was actually very surprised at the craftsmanship and durability with the price. Very satisfied with the purchase, and have referred a few friends that also needed a set!
customer_reviews.author: William Roberts

customer_reviews.title: extremely light weight.
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are very cheaply made and weak. I'm sure they are fine for very light weight applications but bent and are now rubbish on our first use.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but effective
customer_reviews.text: These ramps bend noticeably when I load my log splitter which is around 450lb - Not sure what the SWL on these but I wouldnt want to put much more of a load on them than this. Neat little straps stop the ramps coming away from your trailer/truckbed and they stack together nicely saving storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Chris

customer_reviews.title: Mighty mites.
customer_reviews.text: Really light, plenty strong for my 400# atv. Straps keep ramps in place during loading, and hold ramps together for storage.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: Light but strong
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use - lightweight so easy to maneuver - straps keep it from shifting and is plenty strong. Used this to load my John Deere 20 HP lawn tractor and no problem even with my back problems.
customer_reviews.author: TMH

customer_reviews.title: The ramps worked well and I really liked the secure strap feature
customer_reviews.text: The ramps worked well, but when i received them they were damaged. The lips that sit on your tailgate were bent up and there was a piece of the frame broken off. I didnt return them I used them anyway, I mean they are just ramps nothing intended to be pretty. They worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pro installer

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and light. I used it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and light. I used it to move fully loaded battery golf cart and also riding lawn mower. Would be nicer to have extra cross bars but it's not absolutely necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pomaville

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: great for getting lawn tractor in and out of shed.
customer_reviews.author: Didn't play one on TV

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for loading my Honda Rincon in the back of my 82 Chevy pickup. They would be a little steep if I were to try them on my 09 GMC 2500HD, but I believe they would still work. Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Stark

customer_reviews.title: Great product, serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Used these a couple times now and are able to hold the weight of our 450lb ATV nicely, plus the weight of the rider loading it. Does not buckle or bend in anyway. Like previous viewers have wrote, the ramps are a bit short so make sure to measure before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Heather82

customer_reviews.title: I have an ATV (ARGO) 8-wheeler and they are not ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an ATV (ARGO) 8-wheeler and they are not strong enough to support it. I think, if I had tried, they would have bent. Reurned them.
customer_reviews.author: H2ofowl

customer_reviews.title: They are very sturdy and light weight and exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: These ramps were delivered 3 days sooner than expected. They are very sturdy and light weight and exactly as advertised. Equal in quality of many higher cost ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, I use it for my Raptor 700r and works just fine. It brings the ramp straps for better stability...
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I used them to load a 2007 yamaha rhino 660 but they couldnt hold the weight, they bent beyond use, should have held the weight.
customer_reviews.author: MDW

customer_reviews.title: If you need something quick and cheap these will work ...
customer_reviews.text: If you need something quick and cheap these will work. However, the rungs are too far apart. This causes a really bumpy and uneasy loading of riding lawnmowers. They're also kinda short. Not the safest style of ramps to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dadude34

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done but they are a little flimsy. They bend when loading a small ATV but work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice but spaces are to wide. Must cover with a board
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Jones

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Not worth getting they don't hold up my little craftsman lawnmower bent them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good ramps
customer_reviews.text: I put 1/4" plywood on the ramps to use a hand truck loading a Uhaul trailer. They worked well and made moving a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ahh, music

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps.
customer_reviews.text: Work well and are nice and light to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Bent after using a few times. Still work but worried now.
customer_reviews.text: Very light, pretty short ramps so quite steep. I have a 19 outlander max. Ramp has bent after using half a dozen times.. Has a wow in it from the flex. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Anchor straps are very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Got my snowblower to the shop, fixed and back to me before the next major storm without trailer access.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD VALUE
customer_reviews.text: Worked well with boards for a riding lawn mower to allow front tires to roll smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lory

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Very derable! Great price! It even comes with hooks to hook to your bed of your truck so they don’t slip off.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Good Lightweight Ramps
customer_reviews.text: Good light weight ramps. I use them for loading the snow blower in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this product twice - one set for home use and one set for up at our cabin. They are excellent and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shooter Dog

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Using them still. Easy to fit in the bed of my truck and helps me get out when I’m stuck
customer_reviews.author: devondonderjr

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Use these ramps every weekend. I load up everything from a Honda Recon 250 to a Honda Rancher 420 with these. Work well with my Dodge Ram 1500.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very nice great lite strong quality and excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice great lite strong quality and excellent price. Have used thes several times with no problems loading and unloading our 800lb plus atv.. Thumbs up from us and highly recommend p..
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: SUPER LIGHT .
customer_reviews.text: EASY TO USE .LIGHTER THAN THE OLD STEEL ONES.PRETTY STRONG TO.MAINLY FOR 4 WHEELERS.
customer_reviews.author: ronnie sams

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have used these several times and so far, no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Steel

customer_reviews.title: Works well with 4x4 and F150 combo.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 230lbs with a Yamaha 4x4, and they were perfectly fine loading it into my F150
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were 2' longer
customer_reviews.text: Its very light, but i wish they were 2 feet longer
customer_reviews.author: Vita Boychenko

customer_reviews.title: It's Good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. My only hang-up is the open spaces on the grill that makes it hard to load smaller wheeled machines. Otherwise, for larger wheels it's excellent and a very decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: actually pretty dangerous. Almost broke my leg using this
customer_reviews.text: Not secure, actually pretty dangerous. Almost broke my leg using this...I may have actually.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good ramps for small trucks Just Do Not Ride The Atv Up Theo And Your fine
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: but sturdy enough to load my 650# atv
customer_reviews.text: Multiple sharp edges. A few minutes with a grinder fixed them. Light duty, but sturdy enough to load my 650# atv. Open box price from Amazon made them a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Ronaldus Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps.
customer_reviews.text: Got these cheaper than comparable ramps from Harbor Freight. Comes with the anchor straps too!
customer_reviews.author: D & M Piggott

customer_reviews.title: Not for a 4 wheeler
customer_reviews.text: Ramps are well made but too light to load a 4 wheeler.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold the weight it says.
customer_reviews.text: These work for what they are, but I do not believe that they hold an entire 1200 pounds. Our weight was not even close to that and it started to bow. We will have to reinforce it.
customer_reviews.author: Xena

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not used them yet but look like it will work fine
customer_reviews.author: johnny mccrary

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold 550 combined
customer_reviews.text: These ramps will not hold 550 lbs combined. Got them today and tried to load a 4 wheeler (545lbs) and the bowed.
customer_reviews.author: Kale Salmans

customer_reviews.title: Missing the straps to the ramp.
customer_reviews.text: Straps didn't come with item. Huge hassle loading and unloading, with the ramps sliding all the time. (Zero stars)
customer_reviews.author: Marc T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: about cheapest around do the job and will last awhile,straps are a little tricky so be careful!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Tincher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ramp
customer_reviews.text: Used to simply get riding lawn mower in to and out of shed. Easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: stephen shepanski

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Ramps bowed and one was left permanately bent after leading a golf-cart into my truck. Doesn't seem to support near the weight they are stated to support.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Welch

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold weight as rated. They bent the ...
customer_reviews.text: Will not hold weight as rated. They bent the first use and then broke completely on second use. Only use for light applications.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ramps
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these ramps do come as a set for the price listed. The ramps are very sturdy, the straps work great, and the ramps overall help me get my ltz400 off the back of my truck. Shipping was fast and on time as well.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting my riding mower across ditches, works great for loading too.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum loading ramps
customer_reviews.text: The ramps came quickly. They fit the bed of my Honda Ridgeline well. They appear to be strong enough for a mower or a 4 wheeler. They are light enough to handle easily.
customer_reviews.author: E. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty steep for my Ram 2500 long bed
customer_reviews.text: Pretty steep for my Ram 2500 long bed.The rungs are uncomfortably far apart for my small quads but they hold the weight of my YFZ450
customer_reviews.author: Buyer and applier

customer_reviews.title: Technically they work but they are very short for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Technically they work but they are very short for a standard size or lifted truck and the rings are a bit far apart for a grom.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Champagne

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price these work fine. As stated in another post there is quite a bit of space between the rungs so it is a little bumpy when loading.
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Comes as a pair (2 ramps) and works just fine. I have a 2006 Honda Rancher 350cc and a Ford F150 and these ramps work just fine with that combo. For the price and free shipping they can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Low profile gocarts are a challenge
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and adequate, a little more arc would be helpful. The price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel D Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Gets the mower on the truck.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do what it is designed to do. Been using these ramps to put a 24 horse lawn tractor on my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Allen L Bedsaul

customer_reviews.title: Great product. The spacing between the bars is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The spacing between the bars is a little too wide for my lawn tractor tires, but nothing that can't be fixed by just laying a board over the top.
customer_reviews.author: J Hicks

customer_reviews.title: good ramps
customer_reviews.text: got these for a good deal. they are strong but the end that rests on the tailgate is just metal so it scratches the tailgate cap. other that that they work good
customer_reviews.author: J wil

customer_reviews.title: ATV Ramps
customer_reviews.text: I'm really satisfied with these ramps. While being really light weight, i find these ramps very capable for loading up my ATV and with It's compact size, it's very easy to transport (even on my ATV). You'll need to be sure that it is securely fastened when using it (w/ the Included straps). These ramps were very affordable and including the shipping to Hawaii. Being flat makes it compact enough to fit Under my ATV.
customer_reviews.author: Noland

customer_reviews.title: Light and simple.
customer_reviews.text: Not the strongest out there but will definitely work for any ATV, and the straps are awesome so you can keep the ramps from kicking out while loading.
customer_reviews.author: glockholiday

customer_reviews.title: Price good. Needs met.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I use these ramps for my JD mower, for getting it in and out of an old shed with a floor about 12 to 14 inches above the ground. Met my needs and price.
customer_reviews.author: Jug 45s

customer_reviews.title: Too short but get the job done...
customer_reviews.text: These get the job done but are a little too short...they make the angle up into the truck pretty steep unless you back up to a hill. An inexperienced rider will probably gas it and drive through the back of the truck. The price can't be beat though as long as you are careful.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Ramps are pretty much just as described...and for the money, who can complain? The only thing that I will add is that they are for a 30" max. vertical climb (i.e. if your tailgate sits more than 30" off the ground, you might want to look at some longer ramps). I drive a '13 F-150, and my tailgate is about 32" off the ground, but my driveway is sloped, so I just load my ATV with the truck on the downhill side, and they work like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: probably a really nice set of ramps for a Quad
customer_reviews.text: MOTORCYCLES / QUADS ONLY.probably a really nice set of ramps for a Quad...but my Polaris ranger made them look like a banana the first time I used them. Greg C. Florida
customer_reviews.author: greg cleveland

customer_reviews.title: They are good rams
customer_reviews.text: They are cheaper but they do hold up very well
customer_reviews.author: Rusty A Poe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy , Worked great for my quad
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ramps for the money plus free shipping , Works great for my quad , I have a small trailer that doesn't set to high and they work great on it
customer_reviews.author: clyde r

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy but lightweight aluminum is perfect for loading my Suzuki Quadrunner into the back of my truck. I wish they were another foot longer, and I would give them another star.
customer_reviews.author: Whylarry

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but man, the rungs are ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but man, the rungs are to far apart. Takes a friend and you, now push! NO! I SAID PUSH!!! LOL But it works.
customer_reviews.author: chieftopdog

product_meta.title: Highland (1120500) 69" Aluminum Straight Loading Ramp - Pair
product_meta.description: Highland Aluminum Straight Loading Ramps are designed for easier loading into the vehicle. These ramps include adjustable attachment straps, measures 69” long by 13” wide and can hold a total capacity of 1250 lbs. Rust and corrosion resistant, these ramps are backed by a one year limited warranty. Highland is the leader in cargo management and vehicle protection products, dedicated to helping motorists safely load, anchor, secure, tow, carry, trailer and organize cargo. From Highland’s aluminum ramps and cargo organizers to fat strap bungees and cargo securing products, Highland products are manufactured to quality standards designed to exceed every expectation. Highland continues to be the market leader in loading ramps because of its commitment to innovation, quality and reliability.
feature_bullets: Straight ramp, 13 inches x 69 inches, capacity of 625 lbs per ramp
Sold as a pair, includes adjustable attachment straps
Backed by one year limited warranty
